page.title: 06MARGLASS, SHERBORNE.
page.content: Marglass was established in 1942. They are Europe's largest and foremost producers of glassfibre fabrics. Some of the goods they make are: ROVINGS, SCREENS, FILTERS, ELECTRICALLY CONDUC_ TIVE FABRICS, ASBESTOS REPLACEMENTS and LOUVRE BLINDS. 65% of these products are exported. The firm belongs to a US conglomerate, UM&M,but it is an independent company. They have 300 workers and 150 of them come from in and around Sherborne. The working hours vary. There is a three shift routine, working 8 hrs every shift. They take on some school leavers but not many.The basic wage is Â£100 to Â£115 per week. Future development plans include the installation of newer and faster machinery.
